item.title: Iron Buddha (tie guan yin) Chinese tea 100g
item.description: Iron Buddha (an oolong tea) is the classic Chinese green tea. We've selected a special variety of Iron Buddha for the Min River Tea Farm which has what the Chinese call 'tou suan' - a slightly crisp and tingling aftertaste that refreshes the taste buds and cleans the palette.
item.g:google_product_category: Food, Beverages & Tobacco > Beverages > Tea & Infusions

item.title: Jasmine Pearls Chinese tea (mo li hua) 250g
item.description: Jasmine Pearls tea (mo li hua long zhu) is a deliciously fragrant green tea scented with the leaves of a jasmine flower. Great for special occasions or guests, your local Chinese probably serves a version of Jasmine tea, but don't be fooled. This Jasmine tea is like nothing you've experienced before.
item.g:google_product_category: Food, Beverages & Tobacco > Beverages > Tea & Infusions

item.title: The Big Red Chinese tea (da hong pao)
item.description: The Big Red (da hong pao) is an earthy and honest red tea. It has a subtle red colour and a rich, nutty and rusty aftertaste. Particularly suited to English tea drinkers, it's great in the mornings or when you need a bit of a kick. If you're used to 'builders tea', then this is a more classy, tasty and healthy substitute.
item.g:google_product_category: Food, Beverages & Tobacco > Beverages > Tea & Infusions

item.title: The Big Red Chinese tea (da hong pao) Sampler Pack
item.description: The Big Red (da hong pao) is an earthy and honest red tea. It has a subtle red colour and a rich, nutty and rusty aftertaste. item.title: Jin Jun Mei Chinese tea (black tea)
item.description: Jin Jun Mei is a beautifully sweet and lively red Chinese tea. It has a distinct plummy taste rare in red teas, and makes a great natural tea for anyone with a bit of a sweet tooth! Although it normally commands an exceptionally high price in China, we're lucky to be able to offer it to you at a great discount.
item.g:google_product_category: Food, Beverages & Tobacco > Beverages > Tea & Infusions

item.title: Lapsang Souchong Chinese tea (black tea)
item.description: Lapsang souchong (also known as zheng shan xiao zhong) is a red tea, produced in Wuyi Mountain in the Fujian Province. It's unique taste comes from being smoked over pinewood, which gives it a distinct smokey edge and delicious aroma.
item.g:google_product_category: Food, Beverages & Tobacco > Beverages > Tea & Infusions

item.title: Old Iron Chinese tea (lao tie)
item.description: Old Iron (as it's affectionately known in China) is a charcoal roasted oolong tea. Taking a tie guan yin as a base, the tea is roasted until it takes on a darker colour. The brew offers a unique oolong taste, mixing the clarity and smoothness of a green tea with the heady, full-bodied red tea taste.
item.g:google_product_category: Food, Beverages & Tobacco > Beverages > Tea & Infusions
